title: Mark Chapter 16 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Mark chapter 16 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Mark Chapter 16 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Mark Chapter 16.

questions.question: Who came to the sepulchre to anoint Jesus after the sabbath was past?
options: Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James, and Salome
questions.correctAnswer: Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James, and Salome
questions.explanation: Mark 16:1 states that Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James, and Salome came to anoint Jesus after the sabbath.

questions.question: What time of day did the women come to the sepulchre?
options: Very early in the morning at the rising of the sun
questions.correctAnswer: Very early in the morning at the rising of the sun
questions.explanation: Mark 16:2 says they came very early in the morning, at the rising of the sun.

questions.question: What did the women wonder about when they approached the sepulchre?
options: Who shall roll away the stone from the door of the sepulchre?
Who would meet them at the sepulchre?
If the guards were still there?
questions.correctAnswer: Who shall roll away the stone from the door of the sepulchre?
questions.explanation: Mark 16:3 records their question about who would roll the stone away.

questions.question: What did the women find when they arrived at the sepulchre?
options: The tomb was guarded by soldiers
questions.correctAnswer: The stone was rolled away
questions.explanation: Mark 16:4 says the stone was rolled away from the sepulchre door.

questions.question: What did the women see inside the sepulchre?
options: A young man sitting on the right side, clothed in a long white garment
The tomb empty with no one inside
questions.correctAnswer: A young man sitting on the right side, clothed in a long white garment
questions.explanation: Mark 16:5 describes a young man in white sitting on the right side.

questions.question: What did the young man inside the sepulchre say to the women?
options: He is risen; he is not here
questions.correctAnswer: He is risen; he is not here
questions.explanation: Mark 16:6 records the young man's words that Jesus is risen and not there.

questions.question: Who were the women instructed to tell about Jesus going before them into Galilee?
questions.correctAnswer: His disciples and Peter
questions.explanation: Mark 16:7 says the women should tell Jesus' disciples and Peter.

questions.question: How did the women react after seeing the empty tomb and the young man?
questions.correctAnswer: They fled, trembling and amazed
questions.explanation: Mark 16:8 describes their reaction as fleeing and trembling.

questions.question: To whom did Jesus first appear after His resurrection?
options: The two disciples on the road
questions.correctAnswer: Mary Magdalene
questions.explanation: Mark 16:9 states Jesus first appeared to Mary Magdalene.

questions.question: True or False: The disciples immediately believed Mary Magdalene when she told them Jesus was alive.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Mark 16:11 says the disciples did not believe Mary Magdalene.

questions.question: After Mary Magdalene, Jesus appeared in another form to whom?
options: Two of them as they walked into the country
questions.correctAnswer: Two of them as they walked into the country
questions.explanation: Mark 16:12 mentions Jesus appearing in another form to two disciples walking.

questions.question: What did Jesus say to the eleven when He appeared to them at the meal?
options: He upbraided them for their unbelief and hardness of heart
He praised them for their faith
questions.correctAnswer: He upbraided them for their unbelief and hardness of heart
questions.explanation: Mark 16:14 says Jesus reproved them for not believing those who had seen Him.

questions.question: What command did Jesus give to His disciples before ascending to heaven?
options: Go into all the world and preach the gospel to every creature
questions.correctAnswer: Go into all the world and preach the gospel to every creature
questions.explanation: Mark 16:15 records Jesus' command to preach the gospel worldwide.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'He that believeth and is ______ shall be saved; but he that believeth not shall be damned.'
questions.correctAnswer: baptized
questions.explanation: Mark 16:16 explains that believing and being baptized leads to salvation.

questions.question: True or False: According to Mark 16:19, Jesus was received up into heaven and sat on the right hand of God.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Mark 16:19 states Jesus ascended and sat at God's right hand.

medium.title: Mark Chapter 16 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Mark Chapter 16 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does Mark 16:6 teach us about faith and trust in God when facing fearful or uncertain situations?
options: We should not be afraid because Jesus has risen and is alive
We must rely on our own strength to overcome fear
Fear is a sign of weak faith and must be ignored
We should avoid situations that cause fear
questions.correctAnswer: We should not be afraid because Jesus has risen and is alive
questions.explanation: Mark 16:6 encourages us not to be afraid because Jesus, who was crucified, has risen. This passage reminds believers to place their trust in God's power and victory over death, which strengthens faith in fearful times.

questions.question: A fellow believer struggles with doubt after hearing the resurrection news. According to Mark 16:11 and 16:14, what biblical truth would you share about doubt and belief?
options: Doubt can be overcome by witnessing Jesus personally and through fellowship
Doubt is unforgivable and shows lack of faith
Belief requires no evidence or testimony
Doubt means one should leave the faith community
questions.correctAnswer: Doubt can be overcome by witnessing Jesus personally and through fellowship
questions.explanation: Mark 16:11 and 16:14 show that even Jesus' closest followers initially doubted the resurrection, but He appeared to them to strengthen their faith. This teaches that doubt can be addressed through personal experience and community support.

questions.question: What practical lesson about evangelism and obedience does Mark 16:15 teach us?
options: We are commanded to go into all the world and preach the gospel to every creature
Evangelism is optional and only for church leaders
Sharing the gospel should be done only in familiar places
We should focus on personal growth before evangelizing
questions.correctAnswer: We are commanded to go into all the world and preach the gospel to every creature
questions.explanation: Mark 16:15 clearly instructs believers to evangelize universally. This passage encourages practical obedience to Christ’s command to share the gospel as part of faithful Christian living.

questions.question: Based on Mark 16:16, how does belief and baptism relate to salvation and accountability?
options: Belief and baptism lead to salvation, unbelief leads to condemnation
Salvation is independent of belief and baptism
Unbelief is excusable and does not affect salvation
questions.correctAnswer: Belief and baptism lead to salvation, unbelief leads to condemnation
questions.explanation: Mark 16:16 teaches that belief combined with baptism results in salvation, highlighting the importance of faith and obedience in Christian life, while unbelief results in condemnation, emphasizing accountability.

questions.question: How does Mark 16:17-18 encourage believers to rely on God’s power in spiritual battles and service?
options: Signs such as casting out devils and healing follow those who believe in Jesus
Believers should rely solely on their own strength in service
Spiritual power is only for special people, not all believers
Signs are unimportant in Christian service
questions.correctAnswer: Signs such as casting out devils and healing follow those who believe in Jesus
questions.explanation: Mark 16:17-18 shows that believers who have faith will see God’s power manifested through spiritual gifts and protection, encouraging reliance on God’s supernatural work in ministry and daily life.

questions.question: When a believer faces trials and persecution for their faith, what assurance does Mark 16:20 provide about God's presence and support?
options: The Lord works with believers and confirms their message with signs
Believers must face hardships without expecting God's help
Trials mean God has abandoned the believer
Signs and wonders are only for the early church
questions.correctAnswer: The Lord works with believers and confirms their message with signs
questions.explanation: Mark 16:20 reassures believers that God actively works with them, confirming their witness with signs, which encourages perseverance and trust in God's ongoing support during trials.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with feelings of fear and amazement in difficult circumstances. Based on Mark 16:8, what biblical principle can help them respond faithfully?
options: Even when afraid, believers are called to obey and share the good news
Fear means one should remain silent and avoid action
Faith requires no feelings of fear or amazement
Believers should wait for perfect confidence before acting
questions.correctAnswer: Even when afraid, believers are called to obey and share the good news
questions.explanation: Mark 16:8 shows the women fled trembling but were still part of God’s plan to share the resurrection. It teaches that obedience can occur despite fear, encouraging faithful action.

questions.question: How does Mark 16:7 demonstrate the importance of including all believers, even those who may have stumbled, in fellowship and mission?
options: Jesus instructs to tell Peter specifically he will see Him, showing inclusion despite past mistakes
Only the most faithful should be part of the mission
Mission work should exclude those who doubt
Peter was excluded from the resurrection appearances
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus instructs to tell Peter specifically he will see Him, showing inclusion despite past mistakes
questions.explanation: Mark 16:7 highlights that Jesus includes Peter, who had denied Him, in the resurrection appearances and mission, illustrating forgiveness, restoration, and inclusion in Christian fellowship and work.

questions.question: True or False: According to Mark 16:9-10, Mary Magdalene was the first to witness and report the resurrection, showing the importance of personal devotion and testimony.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Mark 16:9-10 records that Jesus first appeared to Mary Magdalene and she reported it to the disciples, emphasizing personal devotion and the role of testimony in spreading the gospel.

questions.question: True or False: Mark 16:19 teaches that after Jesus spoke to His disciples, He ascended to heaven and is seated at God's right hand, showing the importance of reverence and worship in Christian life.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Mark 16:19 describes Jesus' ascension and exaltation, encouraging believers to honor Christ's authority and maintain reverence and worship as part of spiritual discipline.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: According to Mark 16:2, the women went to the sepulchre to _______ Jesus.
questions.correctAnswer: anoint
questions.explanation: Mark 16:1-2 states the women bought spices to anoint Jesus, demonstrating care and devotion in honoring Him after His death.

questions.question: How does Mark 16:14 encourage believers to address unbelief within the church community?
options: Jesus upbraided the disciples for their unbelief, showing the need for honest correction and encouragement
Unbelief should be ignored to keep peace
Believers should isolate those who doubt
Unbelief is acceptable and should not be challenged
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus upbraided the disciples for their unbelief, showing the need for honest correction and encouragement
questions.explanation: Mark 16:14 shows Jesus confronting His disciples' unbelief, teaching that the church must lovingly but firmly address doubt to strengthen faith and unity.

questions.question: What does Mark 16:1-4 teach about preparation and perseverance in serving the Lord even when facing obstacles?
options: The women came early prepared with spices despite the large stone blocking the tomb
Service to the Lord should be postponed until all obstacles are removed
Difficulties mean God does not want us to serve
Only men are called to prepare for the Lord's service
questions.correctAnswer: The women came early prepared with spices despite the large stone blocking the tomb
questions.explanation: Mark 16:1-4 shows the women’s readiness and determination to serve Jesus despite the heavy stone, encouraging perseverance and preparedness in Christian service.

questions.question: How does Mark 16:12-13 illustrate the importance of sharing personal encounters with Jesus within the faith community despite initial unbelief?
options: Jesus appeared to two disciples who shared the news even though others did not believe immediately
Personal experiences should be kept private
Unbelief means we should stop sharing our faith
Only church leaders should share testimonies
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus appeared to two disciples who shared the news even though others did not believe immediately
questions.explanation: Mark 16:12-13 shows that sharing testimonies is vital even if others doubt at first, encouraging perseverance in witness and fellowship.

questions.question: What biblical teaching about humility and service can be drawn from the fact that Jesus appeared to the eleven disciples and corrected their unbelief (Mark 16:14)?
options: Even Jesus’ closest followers needed correction, teaching humility and openness to God's guidance
Only perfect believers are used by God
questions.correctAnswer: Even Jesus’ closest followers needed correction, teaching humility and openness to God's guidance
questions.explanation: Mark 16:14 shows that Jesus corrected His disciples’ unbelief, underscoring the need for humility and willingness to be taught in Christian life and service.

hard.title: Mark Chapter 16 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Mark Chapter 16.

questions.question: Who were the women that came to anoint Jesus after the Sabbath according to Mark 16?
options: Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James, and Salome
Mary the mother of Jesus, Mary Magdalene, and Martha
questions.correctAnswer: Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James, and Salome
questions.explanation: Mark 16:1 explicitly names Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James, and Salome as the women who bought spices to anoint Jesus after the Sabbath.

questions.question: What surprising condition was found at the tomb when the women arrived early on the first day of the week?
options: The tomb was guarded by Roman soldiers
questions.correctAnswer: The stone was rolled away
questions.explanation: Mark 16:4 states that the women found the very large stone rolled away from the tomb's entrance, which was unexpected and significant.

questions.question: What is the significance of the 'young man clothed in a long white garment' found in the tomb?
options: He signifies the angelic presence announcing resurrection
He is a Roman soldier guarding the tomb
He is a bystander who discovered the empty tomb
questions.correctAnswer: He signifies the angelic presence announcing resurrection
questions.explanation: Mark 16:5 describes a young man in white, a common biblical symbol of an angelic messenger, indicating divine involvement in Jesus' resurrection.

questions.question: What message did the young man in white deliver to the women regarding Jesus?
options: Jesus is risen and not in the tomb
Jesus was moved to another location
Jesus will appear only in Jerusalem
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus is risen and not in the tomb
questions.explanation: Mark 16:6 quotes the young man telling the women Jesus has risen and is no longer in the tomb, affirming the resurrection event.

questions.question: What specific instruction did Jesus give to the disciples through the messenger about where to meet Him?
options: Go to Galilee where Jesus will meet them
Travel to the Mount of Olives
questions.correctAnswer: Go to Galilee where Jesus will meet them
questions.explanation: Mark 16:7 instructs the women to tell the disciples and Peter that Jesus will go before them to Galilee, establishing a meeting place post-resurrection.

questions.question: Which phrase in Mark 16:8 shows the women's emotional reaction to the empty tomb and the angelic message?
questions.correctAnswer: They trembled and were amazed
questions.explanation: Mark 16:8 explicitly states that the women fled the tomb trembling and amazed, highlighting their fear and astonishment.

questions.question: Who did Jesus first appear to after His resurrection according to Mark 16?
options: The two disciples on the road
questions.correctAnswer: Mary Magdalene
questions.explanation: Mark 16:9 identifies Mary Magdalene as the first person Jesus appeared to after rising from the dead, emphasizing her important role.

questions.question: What was the reaction of the disciples when Mary Magdalene told them about Jesus’ resurrection?
options: They immediately went to the tomb
They reported it to the Pharisees
questions.correctAnswer: They did not believe her
questions.explanation: Mark 16:11 states that the disciples did not believe Mary Magdalene’s report, indicating initial skepticism about the resurrection.

questions.question: What is the significance of Jesus appearing in 'another form' to two disciples as they walked in the country?
options: It shows the resurrection body can appear differently
It was an apparition, not a real appearance
questions.correctAnswer: It shows the resurrection body can appear differently
questions.explanation: Mark 16:12 describes Jesus appearing in a different form, indicating the transformed nature of His resurrection body, a theme also found in Luke 24.

questions.question: How does Mark 16:14 characterize the disciples' faith after Jesus' resurrection appearances?
options: They showed unbelief and hardness of heart
questions.correctAnswer: They showed unbelief and hardness of heart
questions.explanation: Mark 16:14 states that Jesus upbraided the eleven disciples for their unbelief and hardness of heart despite seeing Him alive.

questions.question: What commission did Jesus give to His disciples in Mark 16:15?
options: Preach the gospel to every creature
Build a new temple in Jerusalem
questions.correctAnswer: Preach the gospel to every creature
questions.explanation: Mark 16:15 commands the disciples to go into all the world and preach the gospel to every creature, laying the foundation for global mission.

questions.question: According to Mark 16:16, what is the relationship between belief, baptism, and salvation?
options: He that believes and is baptized shall be saved; he that believes not shall be damned
Neither belief nor baptism is necessary
questions.correctAnswer: He that believes and is baptized shall be saved; he that believes not shall be damned
questions.explanation: Mark 16:16 highlights the importance of both belief and baptism for salvation, emphasizing the necessity of faith and obedience.

questions.question: Which signs are promised to follow those who believe according to Mark 16:17-18?
options: Casting out devils, speaking in new tongues, handling serpents, drinking deadly poison without harm, healing the sick
Speaking in tongues and prophecy only
questions.correctAnswer: Casting out devils, speaking in new tongues, handling serpents, drinking deadly poison without harm, healing the sick
questions.explanation: Mark 16:17-18 lists multiple miraculous signs that will accompany believers, demonstrating divine empowerment.

questions.question: After speaking to His disciples, what event concerning Jesus is recorded in Mark 16:19?
options: Jesus was received up into heaven and sat at the right hand of God
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus was received up into heaven and sat at the right hand of God
questions.explanation: Mark 16:19 records Jesus' ascension into heaven, affirming His exalted status and divine authority.

questions.question: True or False: Mark 16:20 describes the disciples preaching everywhere with the Lord working with them and confirming their message with signs.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Mark 16:20 confirms that the disciples went forth preaching everywhere, with the Lord working alongside them and confirming the word with accompanying signs.

theological.title: Mark Chapter 16 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Mark Chapter 16 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: Who were the women that came to anoint Jesus after the Sabbath, according to Mark 16?
options: Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James, and Salome
Mary the mother of Jesus, Martha, and Salome
questions.correctAnswer: Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James, and Salome
questions.explanation: Mark 16:1 identifies the women who bought spices to anoint Jesus after the Sabbath as Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James, and Salome. This is consistent with Luke 24:10 and John 20:1, which also name women as the first witnesses to the resurrection, highlighting the role of faithful followers in God's redemptive plan.

questions.question: What did the women find when they arrived at the tomb early on the first day of the week?
options: The stone rolled away and the tomb empty
The tomb sealed with guards present
The body stolen by unknown men
questions.correctAnswer: The stone rolled away and the tomb empty
questions.explanation: Mark 16:4 states the women saw the very large stone rolled away from the tomb's entrance, indicating Jesus' resurrection. This event fulfills prophecy such as Psalm 16:10 and Isaiah 53:10-11, demonstrating God's power over death and affirming Jesus as the Messiah.

questions.question: How did the women react when they saw the young man in the tomb clothed in a long white garment?
questions.correctAnswer: They were affrighted
questions.explanation: Mark 16:5 tells us the women were afraid upon seeing the young man, an angelic figure, in the tomb. This reflects human response to divine revelation, similar to the fear experienced by Moses at the burning bush (Exodus 3:6) and the shepherds at Christ's birth (Luke 2:9).

questions.question: What message did the young man in the tomb give to the women?
options: Jesus of Nazareth, who was crucified, is risen and not here
The tomb is empty but Jesus has not risen
Jesus will return in three days
They must keep silent about what they saw
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus of Nazareth, who was crucified, is risen and not here
questions.explanation: Mark 16:6 records the angelic message that Jesus, crucified and buried, has risen. This confirms the core Christian doctrine of the resurrection (1 Corinthians 15:3-4), validating Jesus' victory over sin and death as foretold in Psalm 22 and Isaiah 53.

questions.question: What specific instruction did the angel give to the women regarding Jesus' disciples?
options: Tell his disciples and Peter that Jesus will go before them into Galilee
Remain silent and do not tell anyone
Meet Jesus in Jerusalem at the temple
Prepare a meal for the disciples
questions.correctAnswer: Tell his disciples and Peter that Jesus will go before them into Galilee
questions.explanation: Mark 16:7 commands the women to inform Jesus' disciples and Peter that Jesus will appear to them in Galilee. This underscores Jesus' foreknowledge and fulfillment of his promises (Matthew 26:32), highlighting the importance of faith and obedience in the resurrection narrative.

questions.question: Why did the women initially say nothing to anyone about the resurrection?
options: Because they were waiting for Jesus' command
questions.correctAnswer: Because they were afraid
questions.explanation: Mark 16:8 states the women were afraid and thus remained silent. This human fear contrasts with the call to bold witness seen later in Acts 1:8 and reflects the initial struggle to comprehend the resurrection event, which is also noted in Luke 24:11.

questions.question: According to Mark 16, to whom did Jesus first appear after His resurrection?
options: The two disciples on the road
questions.correctAnswer: Mary Magdalene
questions.explanation: Mark 16:9 states that Jesus appeared first to Mary Magdalene after His resurrection, emphasizing the role of women as primary witnesses, which was countercultural and authenticates the resurrection account (John 20:11-18). This appearance affirms Jesus' victory over spiritual bondage, as she had been delivered from seven demons.

questions.question: How did the disciples respond to the reports of Jesus' resurrection from Mary Magdalene and the two disciples?
options: They went to the tomb to verify
questions.correctAnswer: They did not believe
questions.explanation: Mark 16:11 and 16:13 record the disciples' initial unbelief, demonstrating human doubt even among Jesus' closest followers. This fits the biblical theme of faith requiring trust amidst uncertainty (John 20:24-29), and highlights the necessity of divine revelation for true belief.

questions.question: What did Jesus do when He appeared to the eleven disciples as they sat eating?
options: Upbraided them for their unbelief and hardness of heart
Blessed them and gave them peace
questions.correctAnswer: Upbraided them for their unbelief and hardness of heart
questions.explanation: Mark 16:14 tells how Jesus rebuked the eleven for their unbelief and hardness of heart, which reveals the tension between divine revelation and human skepticism. This rebuke reflects God's holiness and the call to genuine faith (Hebrews 3:12-13), consistent with Jesus’ teachings on belief.

questions.question: What universal mission did Jesus give to His disciples in Mark 16?
options: Go into all the world and preach the gospel to every creature
Gather the lost sheep of Israel only
questions.correctAnswer: Go into all the world and preach the gospel to every creature
questions.explanation: Mark 16:15 commands the disciples to preach the gospel globally, instituting the Great Commission that extends salvation beyond Israel to all nations (Matthew 28:19-20; Acts 1:8). This underscores God's redemptive plan for all humanity (Genesis 12:3; Isaiah 49:6).

questions.question: According to Mark 16, what is the condition for salvation?
questions.correctAnswer: Believing and being baptized
questions.explanation: Mark 16:16 states that belief and baptism are necessary for salvation, affirming the New Testament teaching on faith and covenantal initiation (Acts 2:38; Romans 6:3-4). This highlights the necessity of faith in Christ as Savior and the public confession through baptism.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT one of the signs that will follow those who believe, according to Mark 16?
options: Laying hands on the sick for healing
questions.correctAnswer: Multiplying wealth
questions.explanation: Mark 16:17-18 lists signs such as casting out demons, speaking in new tongues, handling serpents, drinking deadly poison without harm, and healing the sick—none of which include wealth multiplication. This teaching aligns with Jesus' promise of spiritual empowerment (Acts 2:4; Luke 10:19).

questions.question: After speaking to His disciples, where did Jesus go according to Mark 16?
options: He was received up into heaven and sat on the right hand of God
He returned to Galilee to continue teaching
He remained with the disciples until Pentecost
questions.correctAnswer: He was received up into heaven and sat on the right hand of God
questions.explanation: Mark 16:19 describes Jesus' ascension and session at God's right hand, affirming His exalted status and divine authority (Psalm 110:1; Hebrews 1:3). This event is critical for understanding Christ's ongoing intercession and lordship (Romans 8:34).

questions.question: What was the role of the disciples after Jesus' ascension, as described in Mark 16?
options: Preaching everywhere with the Lord working and confirming the word with signs
Retreating into hiding for fear of persecution
questions.correctAnswer: Preaching everywhere with the Lord working and confirming the word with signs
questions.explanation: Mark 16:20 states that after Jesus ascended, the disciples preached everywhere with divine accompaniment of signs, confirming the gospel's truth. This aligns with the mission of the early church in Acts 1:8 and 2:43, emphasizing the Holy Spirit's empowerment.

questions.question: What theological truth is emphasized by Jesus’ resurrection appearance first to Mary Magdalene, a woman formerly possessed by seven devils?
options: God’s power to redeem and restore even the most broken
Only men were chosen as witnesses
The resurrection was a spiritual vision only
questions.correctAnswer: God’s power to redeem and restore even the most broken
questions.explanation: Mark 16:9 highlights Jesus appearing first to Mary Magdalene, delivered from seven demons, underscoring God's grace to redeem the most afflicted (Luke 8:2). This reveals the transformative power of Christ over sin and evil, fulfilling Old Testament prophecy about the Messiah’s victory (Isaiah 61:1-3).
